data.text:
HMICFRS’s assessment of Wiltshire Police

Our PEEL (police effectiveness, efficiency and legitimacy), and other force assessments give you information about how your local police force has performed in several important areas.

In our latest assessments of Wiltshire Police, we made the following judgments:

Read our other reports for Wiltshire Police

Wiltshire Police: PEEL causes of concern revisit letter – May 2024

Wiltshire – National child protection inspection post-inspection review – September 2023

Report on an inspection visit to police custody suites in Wiltshire – February 2023

About the force

Wiltshire Police provides policing services to the county of Wiltshire. The police force area covers 1,346 square miles in the south west of England.

There are areas of deprivation and areas of affluence in Wiltshire.

Around 0.7 million people live in a predominantly rural setting. Its numerous small urban areas include the city of Salisbury and the town of Swindon. The resident population is increased by the large numbers who visit or travel through the area each year.
